## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(ggbreak)

df <- data.frame(
  condition = c(
    "Autoreg. parse",
    "Pause",
    "Duration",
    "Text",
    "Pause + Text",
    "Duration + Text"
  ),
  nats_seq = c(50.1, 22.1, 19.7, 5.00, 4.70, 4.26),
  mi = c(NaN, 28.0, 30.4, 45.1, 45.4, 45.8),
  mi_given_text = c(NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, 0.3, 0.7)
)

get_label <- function(mi, word_context = FALSE) {
  out <- character(length(mi))   # always return a character vector
  
  # non-NaN positions
  ok <- !is.nan(mi)
  
  if (word_context) {
    out[ok] <- sprintf("MI(X,S|W) = %.1f", mi[ok])
  } else {
    out[ok] <- sprintf("MI(X,S) = %.1f", mi[ok])
  }
  
  out
}


df$mi_label <- get_label(df$mi)
df$mi_text_label <- get_label(df$mi_given_text, word_context=TRUE)


# Order factors for prettier plotting
df$condition <- factor(df$condition, levels = df$condition)

plot1 <- ggplot(df, aes(x = condition, y = nats_seq)) +
  geom_col(fill = "#556B8F") +
  geom_text(aes(label = mi_label),
            vjust = -0.4, size = 3.2) +
  geom_text(aes(label = mi_text_label),
            vjust = -1.7, size = 3.2) +
  scale_y_continuous(
    limits=c(0, 51),
    breaks = seq(0, 51, by = 2),
    minor_breaks = seq(0, 51, by = 1),
    ) +
  scale_y_break(c(24, 49)) +
  scale_y_break(c(7, 18)) +
  labs(
    x = "",
    y = "Entropy (nats per sequence)",
    title = "Syntactic Entropy given various contexts",
    subtitle = "All tasks but the first are translation from context to syntactic parse"
  ) +
  # geom_hline(yintercept=50.1, linetype="dashed") +
  # geom_hline(yintercept=5, linetype="dashed") +
  theme_bw(base_size = 12)

ggsave("bar.pdf", plot1, width = 9, height = 6, dpi = 300)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.


```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(ggplot2)

# -------------------------------
# Generated parses (different lengths)
# -------------------------------
generated_parses <- list(
  "Autoregressive"   = c("(", "S", "(", "NP", "NN", ")", "(", "VP", "VBZ", "(", "NP", "DT", "NN", ")", ")", ")", "(", ".", ".", ")"),
  "Duration"         = c("(", "S", "(", "NP", "DT", "NN", ")", "(", "VP", "VBZ", "(", "PP", "IN", "(", "NP", "DT", "NN", ")", ")", ")", "(", ".", ".", ")"),
  "Duration + Text"  = c("(", "S", "(", "NP", "DT", "NNS", ")", "(", "VP", "VBD", "(", "PP", "IN", "(", "NP", "DT", "NN", ")", ")", ")", "(", ".", ".", ")")
)

entropy_values <- list(
  "Autoregressive"   = runif(length(generated_parses$Autoregressive), min = 2.0, max = 3.5),
  "Duration"         = runif(length(generated_parses$Duration), min = 0.8, max = 1.5),
  "Duration + Text"  = runif(length(generated_parses$`Duration + Text`), min = 0.1, max = 0.4)
)

# -------------------------------
# Pad sequences to max length
# -------------------------------
max_len <- max(sapply(generated_parses, length))

pad_seq <- function(seq, pad_value = NA) {
  c(seq, rep(pad_value, max_len - length(seq)))
}

# Apply padding
parsed_tokens_padded <- lapply(generated_parses, pad_seq)
entropy_padded <- lapply(entropy_values, pad_seq)

# -------------------------------
# Build long-format data frame
# -------------------------------
df_token <- data.frame(
  context = rep(names(parsed_tokens_padded), each = max_len),
  token_index = rep(seq_len(max_len), times = length(parsed_tokens_padded)),
  token = unlist(parsed_tokens_padded),
  entropy = unlist(entropy_padded)
)

df_token$context <- factor(df_token$context, levels = c("Autoregressive", "Duration", "Duration + Text"))

# -------------------------------
# Heatmap
# -------------------------------
plot2 <- ggplot(df_token, aes(x = token_index, y = context, fill = entropy)) +
  geom_tile(color = "white") +
  geom_text(aes(label = token), color = "black", size = 3, na.rm = TRUE) +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "white", high = "steelblue", na.value = "grey90") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  labs(
    x = "Token position",
    y = "Context",
    fill = "Entropy (nats)",
    title = "Token-level entropy heatmap across contexts",
    subtitle = "The dog walked in the park."
  ) +
  theme(
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1, vjust = 1)
  )

ggsave("heatmap.pdf", plot2, width = 9, height = 6, dpi = 300)

```
